body: The US Department of Transportation and the International Air Transportation Association define hazardous materials as articles or substances which can pose a risk to health, safety, property, or the environment. Hazardous materials are dangerous goods.
instruction: Select each plus sign to find out more.
title: Defining a Hazardous Item

title: New Component Title

body: When transporting items between SJ Family Products facilities or to third parties, you are responsible for determining if an item is classified as hazardous or non-hazardous.
instruction: Select each plus sign to learn the process to prepare items for shipping.
title: Shipping Procedures

body: When items are incorrectly classified for transportation, it can have serious repercussion on the health and safety of those handling the item as well as the environment. Undeclared or incorrectly declared hazardous items have caused many accidents.
instruction: Select the BLUE ARROW to learn more about a real-world event where hazardous materials were incorrectly declared.
title: Real World Repercussions

body: Now it’s time to put all you know together. Can you use the SDS to determine an item’s classification and shipping procedure?
displayTitle: Can you protect people and the planet?
title: Can you protect people and the planet?

body: The hazardous material shipping coordinator (HMSC) is the shipping agent. Their role is to prepare items for shipment. The HMSC will prepare hazardous items for shipping according to federal regulations. The HMSC is trained in hazardous material ground and air shipping regulations. When they receive the request, they:
title: Meet the HMSC

body: Submit shipping requests to the HMSC through SharePoint.
title: Contact the HMSC

body:
There can be serious civil and criminal penalties for not complying with shipping regulations where both employees and SJ Family Products can be liable.

Penalties are assessed on your actions – if you unknowingly or deliberately violated the regulations or acted recklessly despite the potential consequences. The legal consequences apply to both unknown and deliberate violations.

The maximum individual penalty for a criminal violation is a $250,000 fine per incident and five years in jail, or ten years if the violation results in death or bodily injury to any person. The maximum organizational penalty for a criminal violation is $500,000 per day, per incident.
title: Legal Consequences

body:
Properly classifying hazardous materials and following the procedure helps protect people and the planet.

Do you think an employee can transport a small amount of a hazardous material herself from SJ Family Products campus to another?

If you answered yes, you probably had one of these common misconceptions.
title: Do you believe this?

body: There are NO exemptions! Even small quantities of hazardous items must meet general packaging requirements and be transported safely, so you must reach out to the HMSC.
title: The Truth

title: Transporting Hazardous Items

body: The US Department of Transportation (DOT) regulates dangerous goods to protect people and the planet. It is your responsibility to determine if any item that leaves our buildings is regulated or non-regulated. This 25-minute course equips you to spot dangerous goods so you can comply with federal regulations.
displayTitle: SJ Family Products: How to Spot Dangerous Goods
instruction: Complete each topic in sequence.
title: SJ Family Products: How to Spot Dangerous Goods
